page.title: 15WILDLIFE ON THE HILL SLOPES
page.content: On the hill slopes of Portchester there are many kinds of habitats. The disused chalk pit has lizards, slow worms, grass snakes, adders, butterflies, such as Tortoise Shell, Peacock, Red Admiral, Small Blue and Cabbage Whites and many different moths. There are mice, rats, voles and shrews as well as rabbits. Toads are common but frogs are rare. Kestrals and Sparrow Hawks are quite often seen hovering over the open spaces where rodents are. The Swift Martins and Swallows are always flying around. There are many different flowers like Dandelion, Buttercup, Mayweed, Nettle, Daisy, Gorse Poppy, Bluebell, Bird Eye, Greater Bindweed, Dogrose, Bramble, Red Champion Snowdrop.
